factors: Complete architectural transformation from serverless Lambda to containerized microservices
Requires modification of 50+ Lambda function handlers across 6 major domains
Need to implement service mesh (AWS App Mesh or Istio) for inter-service communication
Migration from single AWS Lambda monolith to 8-10 independent microservices
Implementation of distributed tracing, logging, and monitoring infrastructure
Database strategy refactoring to implement bounded contexts per service
Zero-trust security implementation with mTLS between all services
Complex orchestration patterns using existing Janus framework
Integration of multiple AWS services (EKS, Fargate, App Mesh, X-Ray)
Gradual migration strategy required to maintain 99.9% availability

risks.description: Moving from managed serverless to containerized microservices significantly increases operational overhead
risks.mitigation: Implement comprehensive automation, GitOps practices, and team training

risks.description: Distributed transactions across microservices risk data integrity issues
risks.mitigation: Implement saga pattern, event sourcing, and eventual consistency models

risks.description: Inter-service communication adds 10-50ms latency compared to in-process Lambda calls
risks.mitigation: Service mesh optimization, caching strategies, and request batching

risks.description: Each microservice increases attack vectors and authentication complexity
risks.mitigation: Zero-trust architecture with mTLS, service mesh security policies, and comprehensive audit logging

risks.description: Container orchestration may cost 20-40% more than serverless for sporadic workloads
risks.mitigation: Hybrid approach keeping appropriate workloads in Lambda, auto-scaling optimization

migration_complexity: Very High - Requires complete rearchitecture of current serverless platform while maintaining production operations. The platform has 50+ Lambda handlers, complex DynamoDB single-table design, and tightly coupled service interactions that need careful decomposition.
technical_debt: Medium to High - While microservices provide better separation of concerns, they introduce distributed system complexity, eventual consistency challenges, and require significant investment in observability and orchestration tooling.
team_skills_required: Distributed systems architecture and design patterns

internal: Janus framework adaptation for service orchestration
Tabularium schema evolution for service boundaries
Authentication service extraction from Cognito integration
DynamoDB single-table design refactoring per service
external: AWS EKS cluster provisioning and management
ELK stack or similar for centralized logging

justification: This is a complex undertaking that fundamentally transforms the architecture from a serverless monolith to distributed microservices. The existing platform has 50+ Lambda handlers tightly coupled through shared DynamoDB tables and synchronous invocations. Decomposing this into 8-10 microservices requires careful service boundary definition, data consistency strategies, and comprehensive security implementation. The Janus framework provides orchestration capabilities but needs significant extension for microservices. The 4-6 month timeline accounts for gradual migration maintaining 99.9% availability, team training, and establishing new operational practices.
recommendations: Start with a proof-of-concept extracting the Authentication service as it has clear boundaries
Maintain hybrid architecture initially - keep latency-sensitive operations in Lambda
Implement comprehensive observability infrastructure before service extraction
Use Fargate for simple stateless services to reduce Kubernetes complexity
Leverage existing Janus framework for service orchestration rather than building new
Create dedicated DevOps team for platform operations and automation
Implement feature flags for gradual rollout and quick rollback capabilities
Conduct load testing at each migration phase to validate performance
Consider hiring or training specialists in Kubernetes and distributed systems
Document service contracts and API specifications comprehensively
